citation.article-title: Bradyrhizobium cytisi sp. nov., isolated from effective nodules of Cytisus villosus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bradyrhizobium cytisi sp. nov.

Bradyrhizobium cytisi [cy.ti′si. L. masc. cytisus a kind of clover and also a scientific generic name (Cytisus); L. gen. n. cytisi of a kind of clover, of Cytisus, referring to the isolation source of this micro-organism, nodules of Cytisus villosus].
Gram-negative rods.
Colonies are small and pearl white in YMA at 28 °C.
Grows at pH 6–8 and 14–30 °C, with optimum growth at pH 6.8 and 28 °C.
Growth is not observed at 4 or 37 °C.
Does not grow in the presence of 0.25 % NaCl.
Strictly aerobic, with slow growth in YMA medium, forming colonies less than 1 mm in diameter after 7 days incubation.
Nitrate reduction is negative.
Negative for arginine dihydrolase, β-galactosidase and urease production.
Aesculin hydrolysis is weak.
Assimilation of d-glucose, d-mannose, d-galactose, d-fructose, d-xylose, d-ribose, l-arabinose, mannitol, adonitol, N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate and adipate as carbon sources is positive.
Assimilation of citrate, malate and pyruvate is weak.
Assimilation of cellobiose, maltose, l-rhamnose, trehalose, l-sorbose, lactose, sucrose, raffinose, dulcitol, caprate and phenylacetate is negative.
Assimilation of l-proline, l-glutamic acid, aspartic acid, l-serine and betaine as nitrogen sources is positive.
Assimilation of l-glycine and sarcosine as nitrogen sources is negative.
Acid production from d-ribose, d-fructose, d-xylose, d-glucose, d-arabinose and d-mannose is positive.
Acid production from d-galactose and adonitol is negative.
Acid production from mannitol is variable.
Alkali production from pyruvate as a carbon source is negative or weak.
Alkali production from l-glutamate and l-aspartate as nitrogen sources is positive.
Alkali production from l-proline, l-serine and betaine as nitrogen sources is negative.
Resistant to ampicillin, penicillin, cloxacillin, polymyxin B, ciprofloxacin and erythromycin; sensitive to tetracycline, cefuroxime, neomycin and gentamicin.
Nodulates Cytisus but not Glycine max.
The type strain is CTAW11T ( = LMG 25866T = CECT 7749T), isolated from effective nodules of Cytisus villosus in Morocco.
The DNA G+C content of strain CTAW11T is 65.1 mol%.
